Title: Israelis wary of returning to north because they don't trust ceasefire

U.N. Security Council Resolution 1701, adopted in 2006, was intended to create a buffer zone in southern Lebanon and end hostilities between Israel and Hezbollah. The 34 cultural sites affected 'now benefit from the highest level of immunity against attack and use for military purposes,' UNESCO said in a statement, adding that 'non-compliance with these clauses would constitute 'serious violations' of the 1954 Hague Convention and... potential grounds for prosecution'.
